Just so you motherfuckers who can't read Japanese can have the full context ------ Sumire is not a prostitute, she works in a convenience store. She's married (for 3 years) to someone who does band gigs and spends away all their money on pachinko (gambling machines). One day, she's sitting in a bar to unwind and venting everything by talking about her life to Bob. They're about to be kicked out of their place because they're barely making money for rent, and she mentions that she'd do anything, even sleeping with guys for money which she used to do back in highschool, again to make ends meet. She jokingly asks him "Hey, wanna pay me for some sex?  Just kidding..." but Bob was totally up for it. They continued having that relationship, then one day, Sumire notices all of the money she's been saving up was stolen by her husband and lost all of it to gambling. She's had enough. Bob heard their argument through the walls, so he followed her outside. The rest is history.
That's some good stuff

He was about to be taken into custody when Sumire helped him. Bob was alone and anxious, Sumire came to his help without judging him on the surface and that's enough for him to fall in love with her.
